google_play_reviews.content: So much better than Google Authenticator it's not even funny.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Hi Stryder, Thank you for the love! We're so glad to hear you're enjoying the app.

google_play_reviews.content: The government needs to put a ban on these or only make them available to certain people with the right access because this right here is how systems are being compermised I said what I said ü§∑üèº

Inserted the yubikey nfc 5, app did nothing, like it didn't recognize it, tapped it, says key does not support oauth? What am I supposed to do with my key, how am I supposed to use it if the app doesn't recognize it? Waste of money..
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Hi Simon, Our customer support would like to troubleshoot with you to see what the issue might be. You can get in touch with them here: yubi.co/support When you submit your ticket, please let our team know what YubiKey you are using.

google_play_reviews.content: I have an yubico key.. I have to connect the key to this app... But it isn't working...
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Hi there, We're so sorry that you had trouble with the app. Our customer support would like to troubleshoot with you to see what the issue might be. You can get in touch with them here: yubi.co/support When you submit your ticket, please let our team know what YubiKey you are using.

google_play_reviews.content: Could do with a way to scan QR code from pictures. Also fold device when opened, you cannot click add manually button.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Hi Joe, Thank you for taking the time to share this with us! We've passed this feedback along to our engineering team for consideration for our future iterations of the app.

google_play_reviews.content: I just downloaded this app and ran it. It says to insert or tap the Yubikey. I have 3 (1x Yubikey 5 NFC v5.4.3 and 2x Yubikey Nano v5.4.3) which I inserted and tapped (1 at a time) but nothing happens. The app does not see them at all. I am using the newest ChromeOS (v111.0.5563.100). I have used the keys on Windows machines (Win 7, 10 & 11) and they work perfectly on them. It is just this Chromebook that they fail on.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Hi Gregory, We're so sorry to hear you're having issues with the keys and your Chromebook. Our customer support would like to troubleshoot with you to see what the issue might be. You can get in touch with them here: yubi.co/support Please include which Chromebook model you have in your ticket. Thank you!

google_play_reviews.content: Very secure physical key and easy to use.. but please add sorting options like a drag to order the list, and the ability to rename the sign ins we record.... Pleaseeee update the app.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Hi Zeric, Thank you for these suggestions! We're passing this along to our engineering team to add to our feature list.

google_play_reviews.content: Open-Source, Straight-forward and looks nice too! Great job!
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Thank you! We're thrilled to hear you're enjoying the app :)

google_play_reviews.content: I got completely confused by the UI in this update. You can still get your hardware key via NFC, but the app itself does you no favors in explaining how or giving visual feedback on when it does it. You have to change the settings under "On YubiKey NFC tap" from "Launch Yubico Authenticator" to "Copy OTP to clipboard" or "Launch app and copy OTP". It copies to the clipboard while providing no visuals. Seeing "No accounts" is confusing. This is operation is not OTP, that's misleading.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Hi Eli, We're so sorry that you had trouble with the app. Our customer support would like to troubleshoot with you to see what the issue might be. You can get in touch with them here: yubi.co/support When you submit your ticket, please let our team know what YubiKey you are using.

google_play_reviews.content: Doesn't work with Yubikey Bio. When I plug it in, the device blinks orange and nothing displays in the app.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Hi Jeff! The Yubico Authenticator app leverages the OATH functionality and currently, only works with YubiKey NEO, YubiKey 4 and YubiKey 5 Series. The Security Key Series and YubiKey Bio are currently not supported on the mobile app versions as they only support FIDO protocols. However, you can use the YubiKey Bio Series with the desktop app.

google_play_reviews.content: With this update (Feb 13, 2023) I had renewed hopes that my Yubikey 5 NFC would work on my new Asus CX1500 Chromebook. But no such luck. Basic OTP works, but OATH is still non-serviceable. Please? The portable key is the ideal solution and should work perfectly with a Chromebook as a travel computer. But someone, somewhere, just does not seem to be prioritizing this. OATH is a critical step up from SMS, especially when travelling! This has now been a problem for years, and is very disappointing.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Hi Chris, This should be working on your Chromebook. Our customer support would be happy to help troubleshoot with you to see what the issue might be. You can get in touch with them here: yubi.co/support

google_play_reviews.content: Hello could you make a video of the Yubico Authenticator please. Ihave search online. Rather the video be on your website. Thank
google_play_reviews.replyContent: HI there! We have this video on our YouTube channel: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=DsnTDBhtfdE We hope this helps!

google_play_reviews.content: The previous version could do TOTP, and Yubico OTP slot via NDEF, via NFC. But now the OTP doesn't work anymore? I need the Yubi Clip app for that now? An RPM or official Flatpak for Linux would be great. Edit: I don't think we're talking about the same thing. TOTP are the 6 digits, Yubikey OTP is the long string that starts with cccccc. That Yubikey OTP cannot be accessed with the Yubico Authentication 6.x. The previous major version could.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Hi Kees! In our new version of the app (6.1.0), there is a setting that allows you to launch the app and/or copy the OTP, so there's no need to use the Yubi Clip app anymore :)

google_play_reviews.content: I'm very happy that Yubico has finally updated the ancient app of before. This new version feels slick and works perfectly. I'm delighted to see they have finally getting %100 back in track. They have also updated their desktop app companions as well. Not regretting my Yubikeys purchases at all. Security and nice interfaces, can't beat that combination.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Thank you, Eli! We're so glad to hear your enjoying both of the apps.

google_play_reviews.content: New App is awesome. Best way to use TOTP in 2023!
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Hi Chris! This made our week. So happy to hear you're enjoying the app!

google_play_reviews.content: Works as expected, no issues so far.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Hi there! Glad to hear you are enjoying the app. Thanks for taking time to share your feedback with us :)

google_play_reviews.content: I like Yubico. It's very easy to use. But, I have an issue. In the past when I plugged my key to my phone, the app would auto appear. Now I have to open app manually and then insert key. If I do it key first and app after, when touching the key, does nothing. Is this a known bug? Help me out here please. Thanks... 3 stars only until problem fixed. 5 after...
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Hi there, We've recently updated our app (Version 6.1.0) and that release should fix the issue you're experiencing. You'll want to go into settings and that will allow you to enable this.

google_play_reviews.content: Great to have on the go
google_play_reviews.replyContent: We're so glad to hear it! Thanks for taking the time to leave a review.

google_play_reviews.content: I get an error now "Application Not Supported". Doesn't work, please fix it. :(
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Hi Jeff, We've recently updated our app (Version 6.1.0) and we encourage you to try updating to that new version to see if this might solve the issue you're experiencing. After updating, if you're still seeing the error, our customer support team would be happy to help troubleshoot with you. You can get in touch with them here: yubi.co/support

google_play_reviews.content: The updated app needs a newer Yubikey! Now my older Yubikey, that does not have oath, is will not unlock the app. I'm locked out of my authenticator! Thanks Yubico.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Hi Louis, The app does require a YubiKey with OATH support. If you had a YubiKey to register with it originally, it should still work. Our customer support team would be happy to chat with you to see why your YubiKey isn't registering with the app. You can get in touch with them here: yubi.co/support

google_play_reviews.content: Latest update has made the app much worse. Previously, the codes were in giant font, with separation lines between codes and I had an icon set for each account to make it easy to navigate. Now the codes are tiny, gray on gray, lines close together, url on the left and codes on the right so it's easy to mistake adjacent codes and my manually set icons are gone, replaced by randomly colored circles with first letters and no apparent way of setting the icons again.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Hi Martin, We apologize that the UX changes are not what you were hoping for. If you'd like, you can change the font size across all apps (including this one) in your Android Global Settings. This should increase the text size and help alleviate some of these issues you're experiencing on our app.

google_play_reviews.content: Recent updates have made the app completely useless. I have a Yubikey 5 NFC, which I can no longer use with this app. Tapping the key summons the app just fine, but no matter what I do from there, getting a code is impossible. The "finger on the dot" buttons to absolutely nothing, the green refresh button prompts me to tap but still grants no code. Edit: turning on "bypass touch requirement" at least gets me codes now, but come on. Test these things, please?
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Hello! We've recently updated our app to Version 6.1.0. If you're still seeing any errors after updating, our customer support team would be happy to help troubleshoot with you. You can get in touch with them here: yubi.co/support

google_play_reviews.content: Would not recommend latest update, not as nice to use as previous version.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Hi Dennis! We have a new version of our app, Version 6.1.0. that hopefully will solve some of the issues you're experiencing. If you're still seeing any errors after updating, our customer support team would be happy to help troubleshoot with you. You can get in touch with them here: yubi.co/support

google_play_reviews.content: Broke compatibility with two-factor authentication and now I can't access any of my OTPs.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Hi John, Apologies you're having issues with the app. Have you tried updating to our latest version Version 6.1.0? If so and you're still not able to access your codes, our customer support team would be happy to help troubleshoot with you. You can get in touch with them here: yubi.co/support

google_play_reviews.content: New update is frustrating with NFC key. About 60% of the time the app just keeps asking for the NFC key even though it sees the key.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Hi Jordan! We have a new version of our app, Version 6.1.0. that hopefully will solve this issue. If you're still seeing any errors after updating, our customer support team would be happy to help troubleshoot with you. You can get in touch with them here: yubi.co/support

google_play_reviews.content: Unable to use "add account" to add any new accounts to the authenticator app with the yubikey plugged in to the mobile device USB C port. It prevents the keyboard from showing up at all, only leaving the ability to paste any text copied from outside the app.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Hi Osamah, We have a new version of our app, Version 6.1.0. that hopefully will solve some of the issues you're experiencing. For the keyboard, you can go into your Android settings and select 'not hide the keyboard' and that should help! If you have any other questions, you can give our customer team a shout here: yubi.co/support

google_play_reviews.content: Very important app, so I love it. Sometimes I feel it is tedious and I wish authenticating was easier, especially when it's all on the same device.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Thank you for using the app!

google_play_reviews.content: Recent update is night and day better than before. Good to see actual improvements in an app for once
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Hi Brice! Thank you for the love. We're glad to hear you're enjoying the app!

google_play_reviews.content: Please fire the manager who decided to "redesign the interface". Getting a code used to be quick and easy, now it's scroll, search, waste time and click. Bring back the old interface. Efficiency, gentlemen! EDIT: New version also breaks the ability to scan QR code to backup key. "Name already exists". Do you test your releases?

Used to automatically open the app when I inserted my type-c yubikey. Now it doesn't and I have to manually open the app every time. Major loss in convenience after the new update. Update 6.0.2 did not fix this.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Hi there! This has been solved in the new version of the app, 6.1.0 . There is a new setting called ‚ÄúLaunch when YubiKey is connected‚Äù which defaults to false. Enabling it will open the app when a USB YubiKey is plugged into the phone. Hope that helps!

google_play_reviews.content: Overall great üëç I hope there can be an option to generate a notification with OTP code/static password in it instead of copying OTP code immediately. Some snoopy apps keeps reading my clipboard up on open. Meanwhile NFC connection doesn't seemed to be very stable for Yubikey 5 NFC, I've never been able to connect upon first attempt for Galaxy S20 and iPhone 14 pro.

This the first app that I can complement for its UI overhaul, previous view was good and new one is great, more user friendly for those who join Yubico family, so far I have no complains for Yubikey or its app or its support, I would personally recommend it to any individual or corporate
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Thank you for the love!

google_play_reviews.content: I love the new UI layout! Very nice for those of us with a lot of entries, less scrolling now and still perfectly readable despite the increased density. Great app, no-nonsense utility and easy to use.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: So happy to hear it!

google_play_reviews.content: A shorter name would do this app some good. It's so long, it gets truncated in the app menu. Otherwise, just your normal run-of-the-mill app that does what you expect it to do.
When security key NFC [yubi key 5 nfc] will be on list to support app? I have this key and not work with app. It's not supported. This is bad.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Hello! The app uses OATH so it requires a YubiKey that supports that protocol. At this time, the Security Key NFC does not support OATH (only FIDO) so it will not work with the app.

google_play_reviews.content: I've got 4 version 5 NFC keys, but have only been able to add one to the app. What about a backup YubiKey, which I keep on a different key chain? I would like to have at least 2 configured in the app. All 4 are configured in LastPass, so I can use any of them with my computers.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Hello! We've recently updated our app to Version 6.1.0. After updating, if you're still not able to add additional keys, our customer support team would be happy to help troubleshoot with you. You can get in touch with them here: yubi.co/support

google_play_reviews.content: Great app to use with your yubico security USB stick.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: We're happy to hear you're enjoying it!

google_play_reviews.content: Rewrite broke the Neo <-> S10 combo, but the devs were very responsive. 2 days from initial report to fixed version published. Kudos. The app looks a bit nicer than 2.x. Does what it is supposed to, but size increased significantly. Still a 5‚≠ê
Last update broke the app, please fix it.
So far so good üëç
Text is really too small now.

Ok, but the app no longer opens when I insert the key. When you try to select the option to open when key is inserted, it doesn't work and the additional instructions are incorrect. Hope they fix this in an update soon. Otherwise, it works fine for me.

TLDR: APP FINE. PROBLEM IS THE YUBIKEY. The NFC function works fine on most devices; if not, get a USB adapter for a few bucks so you can plug it in. Problem is that my Yubikey filled up far too quickly.. maybe when they designed it, 25 slots seemed a lot, like 640K of memory once did in PC's. But in 2022, that's nothing. Now shopping for competitor devices with more slots. PS: Buy 2 devices, keep 2nd in safe as backup
You can't assign logos anymore in the new version, and all the existing logos from the old version are gone, which means they all look very similar now :(
Edit: Yubico have now released a much needed refresh of the app üôå

Don't upgrade. It still does exactly what it claims but the previous version was leaps and bounds better. The accessibility of this version has jumped ship - the dark mode is grey, not black and the codes are half the size which may cause problems for visually impaired people. There are far fewer settings, many I use. I'd hoped this version would bring the ability to sort accounts but you can still favourite some which helps. I'm rolling back to version 2.2 if I can. This is a backwards step.
Latest update has totally broken my 2FA. It just shows a message to plug in or tap the key and does nothing else, even when tapping the key several times. Did they even test it?
Great new UI, but suddenly the Always open Yubico Authenticator doest work now when plugging in the device
Last update improved the usability a lot.
New update looks sleek
Woah, new version really changed the UI and made it better
By far the best and safest authenticator app around as you need their USB / NFC key to see the codes making it extremely safe. If ever you lose your phone you have nothing to worry about.
